in_favor: The Agreement on Marine Biodiversity of Areas Beyond National Jurisdiction aims to protect marine biodiversity in international waters and seabed.
Marine designations should be strategically located to safeguard key biodiversity areas.
Since 2000, average protected area coverage of marine key biodiversity areas has nearly doubled, but growth has stagnated since 2015.
against: Record-high ocean temperatures have triggered a fourth global coral bleaching event
Rising ocean temperatures are raising new concerns for coral reefs
